trans-unit.source: One-Class Support Vector Machine
trans-unit.target: One-Class Support Vector Machine

trans-unit.source: Creates a one class Support Vector Machine model for anomaly detection
trans-unit.target: Creates a one class Support Vector Machine model for anomaly detection

trans-unit.source: Category: <link xlink:href="ae17795c-6437-47b5-9853-646d77d461b0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning\Initialize Model\Anomaly Detection</link>
trans-unit.target: Category: <link xlink:href="ae17795c-6437-47b5-9853-646d77d461b0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning\Initialize Model\Anomaly Detection</link>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>One-Class Support Vector Model</ui> module to create an anomaly detection model using normal data.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>One-Class Support Vector Model</ui> module to create an anomaly detection model using normal data.

trans-unit.source: This module is used when it is easy to obtain training data from one class, such as acceptable transactions, but difficult to obtain sufficient samples of the targeted anomalies.
trans-unit.target: This module is used when it is easy to obtain training data from one class, such as acceptable transactions, but difficult to obtain sufficient samples of the targeted anomalies.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you need to detect fraudulent transaction, you might not have enough examples of fraud to train the model, but have many examples of good transactions.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you need to detect fraudulent transaction, you might not have enough examples of fraud to train the model, but have many examples of good transactions.

trans-unit.source: You use the <ui>One-Class Support Vector Model</ui> module to create a model and then train the model using the <link xlink:href="d6acbace-a72d-44b9-9878-869115e02458" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train AD Model</link> based on a dataset containing normal cases.
trans-unit.target: You use the <ui>One-Class Support Vector Model</ui> module to create a model and then train the model using the <link xlink:href="d6acbace-a72d-44b9-9878-869115e02458" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train AD Model</link> based on a dataset containing normal cases.

trans-unit.source: You can then apply different metrics to identify anomalies that likely represent fraudulent transactions.
trans-unit.target: You can then apply different metrics to identify anomalies that likely represent fraudulent transactions.

trans-unit.source: Understanding One-Class SVM
trans-unit.target: Understanding One-Class SVM

trans-unit.source: Support vector machines (SVMs) are supervised learning models that analyze data and recognize patterns, and that can be used for both classification and regression tasks.
trans-unit.target: Support vector machines (SVMs) are supervised learning models that analyze data and recognize patterns, and that can be used for both classification and regression tasks.

trans-unit.source: Typically, the SVM algorithm is given a set of training examples labeled as belonging to one of two classes.
trans-unit.target: Typically, the SVM algorithm is given a set of training examples labeled as belonging to one of two classes.

trans-unit.source: The SVM algorithm represents the examples as points in space, mapped so that the examples of the separate categories are divided by a clear gap that is as wide as possible.
trans-unit.target: The SVM algorithm represents the examples as points in space, mapped so that the examples of the separate categories are divided by a clear gap that is as wide as possible.

trans-unit.source: New examples are then mapped into that same space and predicted to belong to one category or another, based on which side of the gap they fall on.
trans-unit.target: New examples are then mapped into that same space and predicted to belong to one category or another, based on which side of the gap they fall on.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes oversampling is used to replicate the existing samples so that you can create a two-class model, but it is impossible to predict all the new patterns of fraud or system faults from limited examples.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes oversampling is used to replicate the existing samples so that you can create a two-class model, but it is impossible to predict all the new patterns of fraud or system faults from limited examples.

trans-unit.source: Moreover, collection of even limited examples can be expensive.
trans-unit.target: Moreover, collection of even limited examples can be expensive.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, in one-class SVM, the support vector model is trained on data that has only one class, which is the “normal” class.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, in one-class SVM, the support vector model is trained on data that has only one class, which is the “normal” class.

trans-unit.source: It infers the properties of normal cases and from these properties can predict which examples are unlike the normal examples.
trans-unit.target: It infers the properties of normal cases and from these properties can predict which examples are unlike the normal examples.

trans-unit.source: This is useful for anomaly detection because the scarcity of training examples is what defines anomalies: that is, typically there are very few examples of the network intrusion, fraud, or other anomalous behavior.
trans-unit.target: This is useful for anomaly detection because the scarcity of training examples is what defines anomalies: that is, typically there are very few examples of the network intrusion, fraud, or other anomalous behavior.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure a One-Class SVM Model
trans-unit.target: How to Configure a One-Class SVM Model

trans-unit.source: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter

trans-unit.source: If you know how you want to configure the model, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.
trans-unit.target: If you know how you want to configure the model, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.

trans-unit.source: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.
trans-unit.target: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.

trans-unit.source: Parameter Range
trans-unit.target: Parameter Range

trans-unit.source: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by specifying multiple values and using a parameter sweep to find the optimal configuration.
trans-unit.target: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by specifying multiple values and using a parameter sweep to find the optimal configuration.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> will iterate over all possible combinations of the settings you provided and determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> will iterate over all possible combinations of the settings you provided and determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.

trans-unit.source: Specify other parameters unique to this algorithm such as the .
trans-unit.target: Specify other parameters unique to this algorithm such as the .

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.

trans-unit.source: You can use the model trained using those parameters, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.
trans-unit.target: You can use the model trained using those parameters, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.target: Options

trans-unit.source: This algorithm supports the following parameters for customizing the model.
trans-unit.target: This algorithm supports the following parameters for customizing the model.

trans-unit.source: Create trainer mode
trans-unit.target: Create trainer mode

trans-unit.source: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:
trans-unit.target: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter

trans-unit.source: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.

trans-unit.source: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: Parameter Range
trans-unit.target: Parameter Range

trans-unit.source: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.

trans-unit.source: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.
trans-unit.target: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.

trans-unit.source: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.
trans-unit.target: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.

trans-unit.source: η
trans-unit.target: η

trans-unit.source: Specify a number that sets the ratio of outliers to support vectors (represented by the Greek letter nu).
trans-unit.target: Specify a number that sets the ratio of outliers to support vectors (represented by the Greek letter nu).

trans-unit.source: This parameter lets you determines the trade-off between the outliers and normal cases.
trans-unit.target: This parameter lets you determines the trade-off between the outliers and normal cases.

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, type a single value.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, type a single value.

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, use the Range Builder to drag the slider and show the completed range, and then indicate how many values to include in that range.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, use the Range Builder to drag the slider and show the completed range, and then indicate how many values to include in that range.

trans-unit.source: You can also type a comma-delimited series of values.
trans-unit.target: You can also type a comma-delimited series of values.

trans-unit.source: You can also select the <ui>Log Scale</ui> option to indicate that the values specified are on a logarithmic scale.
trans-unit.target: You can also select the <ui>Log Scale</ui> option to indicate that the values specified are on a logarithmic scale.

trans-unit.source: ε
trans-unit.target: ε

trans-unit.source: Type a value to use as the stopping tolerance (represented by the Greek letter epsilon).
trans-unit.target: Type a value to use as the stopping tolerance (represented by the Greek letter epsilon).

trans-unit.source: The stopping tolerance, affects the number of iterations used when optimizing the model, and depends on the stopping criterion value.
trans-unit.target: The stopping tolerance, affects the number of iterations used when optimizing the model, and depends on the stopping criterion value.

trans-unit.source: When the value is exceeded, the models stops iterating on the solution.
trans-unit.target: When the value is exceeded, the models stops iterating on the solution.

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, type a single value.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, type a single value.

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, use the Range Builder to drag the slider and show the completed range, and then indicate how many values to include in that range.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, use the Range Builder to drag the slider and show the completed range, and then indicate how many values to include in that range.

trans-unit.source: You can also type a comma-delimited series of values.
trans-unit.target: You can also type a comma-delimited series of values.

trans-unit.source: You can also select the <ui>Log Scale</ui> option to indicate that the values specified are on a logarithmic scale.
trans-unit.target: You can also select the <ui>Log Scale</ui> option to indicate that the values specified are on a logarithmic scale.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: The <ui>One-Class Support Vector Model</ui> module creates a kernel-SVM model, which means that it is not very scalable.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>One-Class Support Vector Model</ui> module creates a kernel-SVM model, which means that it is not very scalable.

trans-unit.source: If training time is limited, or you have too much data, you can use other methods for anomaly detectors, such as <link xlink:href="c3822fa5-1095-4c72-bd1e-fd43d285153a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">PCA anomaly detector</link>.
trans-unit.target: If training time is limited, or you have too much data, you can use other methods for anomaly detectors, such as <link xlink:href="c3822fa5-1095-4c72-bd1e-fd43d285153a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">PCA anomaly detector</link>.

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: This implementation wraps the library for support vector machines named <externalLink><linkText>libsvm</linkText><linkUri>http://www.csie.ntu.edu.tw/~cjlin/libsvm/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This implementation wraps the library for support vector machines named <externalLink><linkText>libsvm</linkText><linkUri>http://www.csie.ntu.edu.tw/~cjlin/libsvm/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The general theory on which <languageKeyword>libsvm</languageKeyword> is based, and the approach towards one-class support vector machines, is described in these papers by B. Schӧlkopf et al.:
trans-unit.target: The general theory on which <languageKeyword>libsvm</languageKeyword> is based, and the approach towards one-class support vector machines, is described in these papers by B. Schӧlkopf et al.:
